unnormalised: **Automotive Sector Gears Up for a Slew of Vehicle Launches, Emphasizing Safety and Sustainability**
normalised: **Automotive Sector Gears Up for a Slew of Vehicle Launches, Emphasizing Safety and Sustainability**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market is poised for a flurry of new vehicle launches in the coming months, with manufacturers focusing on both enhanced safety features and eco-friendly alternatives. Dr. Arpita Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at IIT Madras, highlights the growing demand for vehicles equipped with advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) tailored for Indian road conditions.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki is expected to unveil a refreshed version of the Baleno with improved fuel efficiency and an updated infotainment system. Tata Motors is reportedly working on an electric variant of the Nexon, aiming for a range of over 300 km on a single charge. Mahindra & Mahindra is also teasing a new SUV, speculated to be named 'Scorpio N', with robust off-roading capabilities.

unnormalised: These launches signal a commitment to complying with Bharat Stage VI emission norms and catering to the evolving preferences of Indian consumers. Experts predict a surge in demand for electric vehicles (EVs) in Tier-I cities like Mumbai and Delhi, driven by government incentives and growing awareness of environmental concerns. The average Indian consumer now prioritizes features like ventilated seats and a spacious cabin (at least 400 sq ft) alongside fuel efficiency. The price range for these upcoming models is expected to vary from Rs. 6 Lakh to Rs. 25 Lakh, depending on the segment and features offered. The festive season of Diwali is traditionally a peak period for vehicle sales.
